job_description: Job Title: CTO/Head of TechRole OverviewThe CTO/Head of Tech is responsible for defining, governing, and delivering the institution‚Äôs enterprise-wide digital strategy across core banking platforms, customer-facing applications, investment and wealth management systems, and digital data infrastructure. The role has full accountability for end-to-end digital delivery, including programme and project management, ensuring that complex initiatives are executed on time, on budget, and in line with strategic, regulatory, and commercial objectives.The role partners closely with executive management, investment leadership, and control functions to ensure that digital transformation initiatives are prioritised, governed, and delivered with strong execution discipline, supporting scalable growth, investment performance, and client experience.Key ResponsibilitiesDigital Strategy & Enterprise TransformationDefine and own the enterprise digital vision and multi-year transformation roadmap across core banking, digital channels, and investment platforms.Translate strategic objectives into clearly scoped, prioritised, and sequenced digital programmes.Ensure digital initiatives directly support revenue growth, AUM expansion, cost efficiency, and investment outcomes.Programme & Project Management (PMO Ownership)Own enterprise-level digital programme and project management across all digital initiatives.Establish and lead a central digital PMO covering governance, prioritisation, budgeting, resourcing, risk management, and reporting.Ensure disciplined delivery using appropriate methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, Hybrid), tailored to regulatory and business requirements.Track benefits realisation, milestones, dependencies, and execution risks across all digital programmes.Core Banking PlatformsOversee the digital enablement and modernisation of core banking systems, including deposits, lending, payments, general ledger, treasury, and interfaces to custody and settlement platforms.Drive platform integration and API-led architectures linking core systems with digital channels and investment platforms.Ensure operational resilience, scalability, and regulatory compliance of core platforms.Customer-Facing Applications & Digital ChannelsOwn all customer-facing digital applications including mobile banking, online banking, investor portals, and advisor platforms.Lead end-to-end digitisation of onboarding, KYC, suitability, transaction execution, reporting, and client servicing journeys.Ensure consistent UX, security, and performance across all client segments.Investment, Asset & Wealth PlatformsOversee digital platforms supporting investment management, asset management, private markets, and wealth mandates.Digitise front-to-back investment lifecycles including origination, due diligence, execution, portfolio monitoring, valuation, performance, and exits.Ensure seamless integration with core banking, custody, treasury, and client reporting systems.Data, Analytics & Decision EnablementEstablish a unified data and analytics framework spanning client, banking, and investment data.Enable analytics-driven decision-making for investment risk, portfolio performance, client personalisation, and revenue optimisation.Ensure strong data governance, lineage, and regulatory reporting capabilities.Governance, Risk & Regulatory AlignmentEmbed regulatory, risk, AML, KYC, suitability, and cybersecurity controls into all digital programmes and project delivery.Ensure strong change-management, model risk, and third-party risk controls across digital initiatives.Maintain effective oversight of vendors, system integrators, and delivery partners.Leadership & Stakeholder ManagementBuild and lead multidisciplinary teams across digital product, architecture, data, UX, engineering, and PMO functions.Act as a senior advisor to the executive committee, investment committees, and board on digital execution and delivery risk.Coordinate closely with CIO, COO, CRO, CCO, CFO, and Heads of Banking, Investment, and Wealth.Key DeliverablesIntegrated digital and transformation roadmapStrong PMO with transparent governance, reporting, and delivery disciplineModern, scalable core banking and digital application ecosystemDigitised front-to-back client and investment lifecyclesMeasurable benefits realisation and execution accountabilityIdeal Candidate ProfileExperience15+ years in digital transformation, technology delivery, or programme leadership within banking, investment management, or wealth management.Proven ownership of large-scale digital programmes and PMO functions in regulated environments.Experience overseeing core banking platforms, digital channels, and investment systems.Skills & ExpertiseStrong programme and project management capability, including budgeting, dependency management, and benefits tracking.Deep understanding of core banking, digital channels, and investment platforms.Strong governance mindset with the ability to manage delivery risk in About Us:Ooredoo is a dynamic global Telecommunications player operating in 10 countries serving more than 138 million customers. Ooredoo Qatar employs approximately 1,600 people driving Ooredoo to be the number one choice for world-class communications services in Qatar, and it is a team that you can be part of!About the Role:The Assistant Director, Planning & Reporting is accountable for leading Ooredoo Qatar's end-to-end financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and performance reporting activities. The role ensures timely, accurate, and insightful financial information is delivered to Business Units, Executive Management, and Ooredoo Group, while owning and continuously enhancing the financial reporting and planning framework. The position drives strong financial governance,transparency, and the adoption of advanced analytics, automation, and digital technologies to enable effective decision-making for internal and external stakeholders.Functional Context:Finance plays a critical role in the day-to-day operations and more importantly the strategic management and growth of the Ooredoo group, it oversees day to day operations within Qatar,and supports all M&A activities at Group level, undertaking or overseeing all financial due diligence etc. In the process in order to ensure the groups growth plans are managed from afinancial perspective and group profit targets are achieved within an acceptable level of risk. The department is tasked with the management of all customer bill generation, the management of collections whilst maintaining agreed levels of customer satisfaction and limiting the company‚Äôs exposure to risk. It supports the division by achieving the balance between debt recovery and company image by planning, motivation and control.Role Accountabilities:‚Ä¢ Own and lead Ooredoo Qatar‚Äôs end-to-end financial planning cycle including the AoP and BP, budgeting, forecasting as per the set process and Group's planning instructions.‚Ä¢ Lead the Management reporting processes by producing weekly, monthly, quarterly reports for OQ management and submissions to Group's requirements‚Ä¢ Drive the annual budget and rolling forecast cycles, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives and strong financial discipline.‚Ä¢ Ensure robust financial controls, governance, and data integrity across planning and reporting activities, in compliance with IFRS and internal policies.‚Ä¢ Lead budget allocation to BUs, enforce budgetary controls, and provide monthly variance analysis with clear explanations and corrective actions.‚Ä¢ Designs and structures the reports of financials and non-financials to the needs of the management team and the different BUs.‚Ä¢ Produces on time with high accuracy all necessary reports and automates as much as possible from the process.‚Ä¢ Shares results of financial performance with BUs, discusses with them recommendation and shares results with management.‚Ä¢ Segment/product profitability analysis‚Ä¢ Partner closely with Business Units as a trusted finance advisor, challenging assumptions and supporting commercial decisions.‚Ä¢ Coordinate with relevant stakeholders on corporate scorecard design, target setting, performance tracking, and evaluation process in alignment with strategic priorities.‚Ä¢ Drive the adoption of digital tools, automation, and advanced analytics to improve efficiency and insight generation.‚Ä¢ Lead, coach, and develop the Planning & Reporting team, fostering a high-performance and future-ready finance capability.Minimum Entry Qualifications:Master's Degree in Finance or Accounting or Business AdministrationMinimum Experience, Essential Knowledge & Skills:12 years' experience in a similar role.Experience in working on financial reporting for a large telecommunications company Show more Show less

Arabic is a strong plus Recent experience in payments or fintech (PSPs, acquiring, gateways), with a solid understanding of payment flows and local methods Proven success closing large enterprise deals in the GCC, with focus on KSA and/or UAE Established relationships with large merchants (e-commerce, marketplaces, airlines, telcos, or similar) Strong knowledge of the GCC payments ecosystem, including regulators, banks, acquirers, and PSPs Strong command of CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce) and standard productivity tools Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills Strategic and analytical mindset, comfortable building business cases and ROI models Ability to thrive in fast-paced, high-growth startup environments with autonomy and ownership Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (MBA is a plus) Willingness to travel frequently across the GCCüü£ What Yuno offers youCompetitive compensationRemote work - You can work from anywhere!Home office bonus - We offer a one-time allowance to help you create your ideal home officeWork equipmentStock optionsHealth Plan, no matter where you areFlexible Days offLanguage, professional, and personal growth coursesWe may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. job_title: Head of Finance - For Euro Foods Group - Job ID - 1458205
job_description: Euro Foods Group is looking for Head of FinanceJob Description / Responsibility1. ROLE PURPOSEThe Head of Finance is the senior financial leader of Masala Bazaar, responsible for:Financial strategy and controlAccurate reporting and complianceCash flow protectionProfitability visibilityGovernance of the entire finance functionThis role ensures the Managing Director always has clear, reliable financial insight to make business decisions.This is not a bookkeeping role. It is a leadership, control, and decision-support role.2. PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITY (NON-NEGOTIABLE)The Head of Finance is fully accountable for:Accuracy of all financial reportingTimely production of management accountsCash flow visibility and protectionCompliance with UK tax, VAT, and statutory rulesStrength of financial controls across stores and head officePerformance and discipline of the finance teamIf finance information is late, unclear, or incorrect ‚Äî this role owns it.3. CORE RESPONSIBILITIESA. FINANCIAL LEADERSHIP & STRATEGYAct as financial partner to the Managing DirectorTranslate business activity into clear financial insightSupport:Store performance improvementCost optimisationLead annual budgeting and financial planningBuild long-term financial stability for the groupB. MANAGEMENT REPORTING & PERFORMANCE ANALYSISOversee preparation of:Monthly management accountsStore-level P&LMargin analysis by categoryLabour-to-sales ratiosEnsure reports include:Clear commentaryRoot-cause analysisRecommended actionsPresent financial performance to MD in simple, decision-ready formatC. CASH FLOW & WORKING CAPITAL CONTROLMaintain daily visibility of cash positionApprove weekly cash flow forecastsControl:Payment timingSupplier exposureBank balancesEnsure business always has sufficient liquidity to trade and growD. FINANCIAL GOVERNANCE & INTERNAL CONTROLDesign and enforce strong finance controls across:Purchase-to-PaySales reconciliationStock adjustmentsExpense approvalsEnsure:Segregation of dutiesClean audit trailsNo undocumented transactionsPrevent fraud, leakage, and control failuresE. MULTI-STORE RETAIL FINANCIAL OVERSIGHTMonitor:Daily sales vs depositsStore margin performanceWastage and shrinkage indicatorsIdentify underperforming stores earlyWork with Ops and Buying to correct issuesF. TAX, VAT & STATUTORY COMPLIANCE (UK)Ensure full compliance with:UK VAT regulationsPAYE / NI / pension rulesCorporation tax requirementsOversee:Accurate submissionsTimely filingsAudit readinessLiaise with:External accountantsAuditorsHMRC advisorsZero penalties is the expected standard.G. BANKING, FUNDING & FINANCIAL RISKMonitor:CovenantsInterest costsFinancing risksSupport funding for:New storesRefitsExpansionH. TEAM LEADERSHIP & DEVELOPMENTLead the entire finance function from BangladeshDefine:Clear responsibilitiesPerformance standardsReporting disciplineTrain and develop team capabilityBuild succession within finance structureMaintain a high-integrity, high-discipline cultureI. SYSTEMS, AUTOMATION & PROCESS IMPROVEMENTImprove finance systems and reporting toolsReduce:Manual errorsDelaysInefficienciesDrive:AutomationStandardisationScalable finance processesJ. RISK MANAGEMENT & ESCALATIONIdentify financial risks early, including:Cash shortagesMargin erosionCompliance breachesFraud indicatorsEscalate immediately to Managing DirectorMaintain transparency at all times4. KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS (KPIs)Monthly accounts delivered accurately and on timeClear visibility of store profitabilityStable, well-managed cash flowZero compliance penalties or audit failuresReduction in unexplained variancesStrong finance team performanceEducational RequirementsMaster of Business Administration (MBA) in FinanceExperience Requirements3 to 6 year(s)The applicants should have experience in the following business area(s):IT Enabled Service,Garments,Shrimp,Chain shop,Food (Packaged),Beverage,Ice Cream,Bakery (Cake, Biscuit, Bread)5. REQUIRED EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONSEssential10‚Äì15+ years finance experienceSenior role in retail or multi-site businessStrong UK accounting, VAT, and compliance knowledgeProven leadership of finance teamsHigh analytical and control capabilityDesirableACCA / CIMA / CA qualifiedExperience supporting UK-based companies from offshoreExposure to retail EPOS and stock systems7. PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES REQUIREDAbsolute integrity and honestyStrong ownership mindsetCalm under pressureWillingness to challenge issuesClear communicator with senior leadershipDisciplined, structured thinker8. AUTHORITY LEVELCan:Stop non-compliant paymentsEscalate directly to Managing DirectorRecommend strategic financial decisionsCannot:Commit major expenditure without MD approval9. SUCCESS IN THIS ROLE LOOKS LIKEMD always knows the true financial positionProblems are identified early, not lateCash is controlledMargins are protectedFinance runs quietly, accurately, and reliablyJob LocationBangladesh Show more Show less

job_description: TALHA GROUP (A strategic alliance with Noman Group) is looking for Assistant Manager - FinanceJob Description / ResponsibilityPrepare, review, and manage all banking and loan documentation, ensuring accuracy and compliance.Draft and coordinate submission of sanction letters, loan applications, renewal requests, and facility reviews.Liaise with banks for the execution of loan agreements, security documents, and charge registration (ROC filings).Maintain and update documentation related to: Term loans and working capital facilities., Bank guarantees and letters of credit (LCs), Collateral and security documentation, Covenant compliance and periodic reporting to lenders, Ensure timely renewal of limits and compliance with sanction terms and conditions.Risk Management and Regulatory Compliance: Ensure compliance with bank covenants, BB guidelines, and corporate finance regulations, monitor exposure to interest rate and currency risks; recommend mitigation measures., Coordinate with statutory auditors, internal auditors, and regulatory authorities for financial audits, maintain proper records and ensure timely filings and renewals of financial and legal documents.Assist the Supervisor and Head of Department (HOD) -Finance in daily operations and reporting.Prepare project-wise and month-wise stock reports accurately and on time.Collect, prepare, and submit required documents to all banks as per instruction.Maintain and organize all finance-related files, records, and documents systematically.Support in preparing financial statements.Assist in reconciliation and verification of financial transactions.Communicate and coordinate with internal departments and external stakeholders as required.Perform any other duties assigned by the Supervisor or HOD.Educational RequirementsB.B.A/M.B.A in any Finance or Accounting / Masters in Finance or Accounting from a reputed university.Experience Requirements5 to 10 year(s)The applicants should have experience in the following business area(s): Garments,Textile,Garments Accessories,SpinningAdditional RequirementsMinimum 5-10 years working experienceStrong knowledge of basic accounting principles, financial statements, and finance concepts.Proficient in computer operations, especially MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), and skilled in typing both Bangla (Bijoy) and English.Ability to prepare financial reports, maintain records.Must be honest, sincere, and punctual.Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlinesJob LocationDhaka (Gulshan) Show more Show less

working experience with Endpoint security technologies, Backup, Patching and SIEM tools. operations.Propose innovative solutions leveraging emerging technologies (AI/ML, IoT, cloud-native services, automation).This role is accountable for the operational management, reliability, performance, and strategic enhancement of Airport Operational Systems (AOS). The Systems Controller serves as the technical owner, ensuring systems meet business, operational, and regulatory requirements while driving continuous improvement and innovation across airport technology ecosystems.QualificationsBachelor‚Äôs Degree or Equivalent with minimum 5‚Äì7 years of progressive job-related experience in enterprise IT environments, with direct experience managing mission‚Äëcritical operational systems.Master‚Äôs Degree or professional certifications (ITIL, TOGAF, PMI‚ÄëPMP, AWS/Azure, CISSP) are an advantage.Proven track record managing complex software implementation, integrations, upgrades, and system support in an enterprise or aviation environment.Strong practical knowledge of software development life cycle (SDLC), modern system design principles, architectural patterns, and technical documentation standards.Good understanding of:Modern programming languages (e.g., Python, .NET, Java)Web services, REST APIs, microservices, and cloud-native architectures.Understanding of airport operational systems (AOS), aviation processes, data elements, workflows, and operational constraints.Experience with systems such as: AODB, RMS, FIDS, BHSGood knowledge of:N‚ÄëTier architecture and distributed systemsClient‚Äëserver and web application methodologiesIT service management (ITSM) based on ITILIncident, problem, and change management processes.Cybersecurity and data protection practices.Working experience in Agile, Scrum, DevOps, and hybrid SDLC environments.Experience in technical evaluations, vendor coordination, cloud/SaaS assessments, and RFP technical scoring.Strong analytical skills with ability to perform deep-dive root-cause analysis, trend analysis, and system performance assessments.Strong stakeholder management skills with ability to communicate with non-technical and senior leadership audiences.Strong verbal and written communication skills.Ability to work under pressure in operational environments. job_description: Role: Engineering ManagerLocation: Fraser Suites - DohaSalary: CompetitiveWe are looking for a Engineering Manager to join the team here Frasers Suites in Doha. The role will be to ensure all resident accommodation, resident public areas, back-of-house and building operating systems are presented and maintained to a high standard and that appropriate preventative detection systems are in place in accordance with Frasers Hospitality‚Äôs CARE program and all statutory requirements. What You Will Be Doing As Engineering ManagerImplement and manage planned preventative maintenance (PPM) schedules for all Fraser Suites Doha plant, equipment and operating assets to ensure efficient and continuous operation. Areas covered include all guest apartments and access corridors, Fraser Suites lobby, business center, back of house offices, leisure facilities, food and beverage outlet, plant rooms, Fraser Suites storerooms and car parks. Maintain and manage all operating manuals, service and product warranties, supplier details and product specifications in hard and soft copy. Manage external service providers in accordance with agreed performance and servicing requirements. Manage the procurement of services by outsourced providers using tender specifications in an agreed format in consultation with the General Manager and Finance Controller. Manage the reporting and rectification of building, plant and equipment defects in consultation with the project manager, during the 12-month defect liability period. Obtain and keep on file all building license and certification documentation provided at practical completion. Maintain a complete copy of ‚Äòas built‚Äô drawings, electrical schematics, hydraulic and essential services plan for ongoing reference. Manage all relationships with external agencies including planning authorities and government departments. ‚ñ™ Manage operating supplies and asset inventories in accordance with company guidelines. Manage and direct the activities of the maintenance team to ensure building presentation, maintenance of facilities and all functional aspects of the property are operating in accordance with agreed guidelines and standardsIt would be great to have recognised trade qualifications in either electrical or hydraulic disciplines. A current driver‚Äôs license and machine operator‚Äôs license and previous management experience within a 5-star hotel maintenance operations department of not less than 3 years.Who are Frasers Hospitality?Conceived with the lifestyle preferences of today‚Äôs discerning travelers in mind, Frasers Hospitality has three award-winning branded serviced residences offerings ‚Äì the Gold-Standard Fraser Suites, Fraser Place and Fraser Residence, as well as Modena by Fraser, a second-tier brand targeted at the road warrior and Capri by Fraser, a design-led hotel residence aimed at the Millennial business traveler.With 80% of our residents from Fortune 500 and Forbes-listed companies, Frasers‚Äô intrinsic understanding of the importance of excellence in service and innovation in meeting the evolving needs of corporate travelers is reflective in the number of prestigious accolades garnered over the years.In addition to competitive rates of pay we also offer a range of great benefits.Interested?? Click Apply NowFrasers Hospitality are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.
